lexUnit.name: tell.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: communicate a story, tale, etc (support only)

sentence.text: The statue in the center of the plaza tells the real story of the town , though .
On the upper floors ( once the royal chambers ) there is an exhibition telling the story of the royal regalia .
John , one of the group , has just told a joke .
One guest told bitter little jokes about Saddam Hussein and his family , none very funny .
Students poked fun at Mr Hall and told a stream of dirty jokes .
Honestly , I do n't invent the singing waiters , acrobatic chefs , undiscovered Kenneth Branaghs and owners who tell the same joke twice .
I tell jokes too .
I 've had worse than that playing dominoes ! " , you should never tell the following jokes anywhere near the doctor 's surgery .
Nearly all our crew were to tell us harrowing anecdotes of personal encounters with hungry pythons -- some of which had been measured at over twenty-eight feet long .
He told them dirty jokes , irrepressible as ever .
She told the anecdote with a glint of relish in her eye , revelling in their embarrassment .
He will be telling stories about his life and times in Roman Colchester , giving children an authentic insight into the town 's past .
Like Beckett 's trilogy , though in much lighter vein , At Swim-Two-Birds thus becomes a story about a man telling a story about storytelling .
It is the detailed , etched pictures that really tell the tale ; the text serves to reinforce the story but suggests rather than dictates the plot , with different monkeys taking over as narrator .
This experiment used an operant conditioning technique in order to modify subjects ' spontaneous pause patterns while they were telling stories .
And she does this by telling the stories of her different heroes in a series of ever more tense situations of suspense , situations where the outcome is fearfully doubtful .
The ` good " child will often tell tales on the naughty one under the guise of helping the parents know what is going on .
In the villages of Bangladesh the folk-songs , even the tapestries women make , tell stories of love and romance .

She and her colleagues visit as many of them as possible at fortnightly intervals to tell the children stories from picture books , and to get to know the supervisors and staff and the children 's mothers .
Her caressing , lullaby tones couple child-like sensitivity with reflective awareness , and as such is an ideal vehicle for telling fairy tales .
But for a combination of quick thinking , good luck and the skill of medical staff , neither would be here to tell the tale .
As Mrs Knelle descended from the mountains , she told me stories attached to various landmarks .
She had told him a tale , looking slyly at him while she played with his left hand .
Berman , 1982 ) , and I feel with some passion that ordinary people deserve , at least , an opportunity to tell their own stories ( see Rowles , 1978 ) .
